Description: Bronze kneeling figure of a king; plinth and two tangs beneath.
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Gumaiyima, Foundations of the southern part of the main building of the temenos (?)
Curator's comments: Very probably one of the "two gilt bronze figures of a king", "kneeling with hands stretched out in adoration", found in foundations of the southern part of the main building of the temenos Gumaiyima, mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 39, 40; the other one would be Boston, MFA 87.480.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.49)
